parents.mother: Dieudonnée Chappouxatte from Roville-aux-Chesnes near Rambervillers

sabbat_activities: carrying pieces of wood instead of candles
eating oysillons with no salt or drink

testimony.quarrel_subject: asked her to undertake pilgrimage for sick daughter, she delayed; then neighbors advised obtaining bread, salt, and ashes from her

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 3 days after giving soup made with bread, salt, and ashes from accused
some 2 years after suspicions about daughter's death

testimony.quarrel_subject: refused accused's offer to work on linen, causing disdain
dispute over payment - accused wanted to reduce price by 2 deniers for vat relining
testimony.threat_quote: struck girl on shoulder twice, telling her she was paid

testimony.quarrel_subject: hired her to work in garden at agreed price, then sent daughter and another woman for next stage - accused made threatening remarks
quarrel between accused's husband Bastien Delat and François Mengenat; witness tried to mediate but Delat was angry; afterwards he and wife ignored witness

witnesses.name: Barbe fille de feu Rock Olry

testimony.quarrel_subject: wife went to get payment from accused; gave it unwillingly, saying she would repent

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: drowned in shallow stream at Provencheres after accused touched it

witnesses.name: Jehennon veuve Claudon Roze de la Rochatte

testimony.quarrel_subject: found accused taking unripe fruit from pear tree before permitted date and told her off
made a 'hotte' for her husband, wanted to be paid without deleting debt of 6 gros
testimony.threat_quote: he or his family would repent

testimony.quarrel_subject: son Demenge called her witch near gate of La Rochatte, she struck him with stick so he fell down

witnesses.name: Marguitte femme Didier Valat de la Rochatte

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: gave birth to child which had never been able to walk or speak

testimony.quarrel_subject: asked wife for loan of 9 gros, which she refused since she had no money; or because accused had to leave house when witness went to live there

lost a fine knife at wedding feast, was told Claudette had picked it up; she admitted but said husband had taken it; wife was sent to get it but accused denied having it, said she had been beaten by husband
husband bought two donkeys, asked her husband to make harness for one; he was very slow, so bought one elsewhere
accused was serving her as maid and allowed pigs to escape after disobeying instructions; when told off went back to mother; row with mother followed
testimony.threat_quote: told them of her suspicions, threatening to have them burned if they did not cure her son Diey

harms_alleged.attributed_to: Claudette femme Bastien Delat or her mother
Claudette femme Bastien Delat or her mother

testimony.quarrel_subject: had been owed 3 francs for bread, asked for payment through wife when he needed to buy more grain

timeline.subject: Claudette femme Bastien Delat
timeline.details: Procureur d'office for canons received denunciation of evil reputation and asked for information to be taken from witnesses

timeline.subject: Claudette femme Bastien Delat
timeline.details: Procureur ordered arrest, interrogation, and confrontations

timeline.subject: Claudette femme Bastien Delat
timeline.details: Generally denied all charges, although admitted striking boy who called her witch

timeline.subject: Claudette femme Bastien Delat
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses; procureur asked for question ordinaire

timeline.subject: Claudette femme Bastien Delat
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; confessed before thumbscrews were applied

timeline.subject: Claudette femme Bastien Delat
timeline.details: Added details about sabbat; persisted with confessions

timeline.subject: Claudette femme Bastien Delat
timeline.details: Confirmed confessions; named 5 accomplices; procureur asked for execution in usual form

timeline.subject: Claudette femme Bastien Delat
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves execution, specifying she should feel the fire before being strangled

methods: thumbscrews (threatened but not applied - confessed before application)

accomplices_named.context: Named at sabbat; also mentioned as healer who cut ear of cow

accomplices_named.context: Named at sabbat; confirmed in later interrogation

accomplices_named.name: Jean Lassenatte le vieux
accomplices_named.context: Named at sabbat initially; later discharged - accused said she had accused him falsely because his son-in-law Jean Jaley, master of the poor, had not given her bread of poor she wished for 12 weeks earlier

accomplices_named.name: Claudon Jacquemin
accomplices_named.context: Named at sabbat; confirmed in later interrogation

prior_accusations.context: Accused Claudette's mother of killing her daughter

notable_quotes.speaker: Colas Hanns
notable_quotes.french: c'est toy qui me pense suffocquer et empescher à mon mariage, mais je diray mes prieres, prendray de l'eaue beniste, me confesseray, et requenteray la saincte communion sy souvent que tu n'aura nulle puissance sur moy, ou bien je te feray prendre ou apprehender, ou bien de faire et parfaire ton proces
notable_quotes.context: Spoken while coming out of strange fits, naming accused; laughing as if out of his mind

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudette's husband (reported by witness)
notable_quotes.french: if child recovered it would be said she had given the sickness and cured it
notable_quotes.context: Reason husband forbade Claudette from undertaking pilgrimage for sick child

notable_quotes.speaker: Witness about Claudette's mother
notable_quotes.context: Claudette describing her mother when asked about harm

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Ferry alias Marande
notable_quotes.french: n'ayant osé affliger sondit fils, de peur que l'on ne decouvrit appertement son venin
notable_quotes.context: Explaining why he took no action after accused struck his son

relationships.evidence_text: Marguitte femme Didier Valat de la Rochatte
Wife became ill and died in 2 weeks
accused was serving her as maid
Had been quarrel between her husband Bastien Delat and François Mengenat
The porter, Nicolas Miette le jeune

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over payment and debt: Claudon du Haud wanted to be paid without deleting debt of 6 gros; Jacquat Durand was owed 3 francs for bread; payment disputes with Marion femme Colas Aubertin over vat relining (2 deniers); Nicolas Thoussainct Grattain's wife had to get payment from accused (gave it unwillingly); Diez Drouin's wife refused loan of 9 gros. Accused relied on spinning and day-labour for livelihood; said she and husband were poor and unable to feed their son Jean. Mother became vagabond and died begging. Accused lived in various mills her parents leased. Confession mentions killing son because of poverty.

harms_catalog.harm_description: strange illness; died in 3 days after soup made with bread, salt, and ashes from accused
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: asked accused to undertake pilgrimage to St Mairin for sick child; she delayed and her husband said it would be said she had given sickness and cured it

harms_catalog.harm_description: struck on head; eyes became swollen; now almost blind
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: suspicions about daughter's death came to ears of accused

harms_catalog.victim_name: daughter of Marion femme Colas Aubertin
harms_catalog.harm_description: felt ill and took to bed; kept saying she saw accused who told her she had put a caterpillar inside her which would remain as long as she lived; felt something wanted to come out of head
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute over payment for vat relining - accused wanted to reduce price by 2 deniers; struck girl on shoulder twice
harms_catalog.method_alleged: struck on shoulder; caterpillar allegedly put inside

harms_catalog.harm_description: cow died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: hired her to work in garden at agreed price; later sent daughter and another woman for next stage; accused made threatening remarks saying they would repent

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill for a year; felt as if something heavy was pressing on him at night and could not move
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: tried to mediate quarrel between accused's husband and François Mengenat; Delat was angry; afterwards he and wife ignored witness

harms_catalog.victim_name: Barbe fille de feu Rock Olry
harms_catalog.harm_description: seemed to see accused whenever she turned head; told she had been given a great caterpillar with big feet which might finally strangle her; pain traveled all round body; pain left by one leg which still troubled her sometimes
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute over payment

harms_catalog.victim_name: horse belonging to Nicolas Thoussainct Grattain
harms_catalog.harm_description: died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: wife went to get payment; accused gave it unwillingly, saying she would repent

harms_catalog.victim_name: second horse belonging to Nicolas Thoussainct Grattain
harms_catalog.harm_description: drowned in shallow stream at Provencheres
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: as he set out on journey en allemaigne, met accused in porch; thought she touched the horse

harms_catalog.victim_name: two more horses belonging to Nicolas Thoussainct Grattain
harms_catalog.harm_description: lost them both
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: after second horse death

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill, as if out of her mind
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: general context of horse deaths
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder in butter ritual (ninth leaf emerged petillant, accused appeared)

harms_catalog.harm_description: had great pain in ear, becoming deaf; ill for some 12 weeks; swelling spread to throat and seemed to choke him; died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: made a hotte for her husband, wanted to be paid without deleting debt of 6 gros; she said he or his family would repent

harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: gave birth to child after quarrel

harms_catalog.harm_description: cradle repeatedly fell over despite invocation of God and saints and use of holy water; found baby's face scratched; when child grew it could not walk properly and finally died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: on Christmas Eve asked wife for loan of 9 gros, which she refused since she had no money; or because accused had to leave house when witness went to live there

harms_catalog.harm_description: stillbirth
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: lost a fine knife at wedding feast; accused admitted picking it up but said husband had taken it; wife sent to get it but accused denied having it, said she had been beaten by husband

harms_catalog.harm_description: unable to say a word when went to confess after unintentionally getting in front of accused; had to go back another time
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: previous Christmas

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell strangely ill, at first thought to be dying; still subject to strange fits starting in finger or toe which would make him blind or dumb; would say naming accused 'c'est toy qui me pense suffocquer' while laughing as if out of mind
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: husband bought two donkeys, asked her husband to make harness; he was very slow so bought one elsewhere

harms_catalog.harm_description: died

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: had been owed 3 francs for bread; through wife asked for payment when he needed to buy more grain

harms_catalog.harm_description: killed with powder
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: during great dearth she was not always given enough bread

killed

harms_catalog.harm_description: killed by accused 2 years earlier because she and husband were poor and unable to feed him

butter ritual with 9 leaves of venges

hearsay_chains.source: Mengeatte femme Bastien Gros Jean (healer, executed)
hearsay_chains.content: said she cut ear of cow and when no blood came out said it was bewitched and would die

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: said that Demenge Drouin had stolen some cloth, naming others who could testify to this
said witness had beaten her son and made his nose bleed - witness admitted this was true, he had been fighting her son, and no harm came of it
said she had not told her anything about toads, but might well have said that she was reputed to have killed cattle at Robache

third_parties.name: François Mengenat
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: involved in quarrel with accused's husband
third_parties.context: portier à la Rochatte; accused's husband Bastien Delat falsely accused him of driving his own mother out of house

third_parties.name: Nicolas Miette le jeune
third_parties.context: porter at La Rochatte; thought accused had killed boy outright when she struck him with stick; called out to her and she fled

third_parties.name: Mengeatte femme Bastien Gros Jean
third_parties.context: healer of animals; later executed as witch; cut ear of Claudon Estienne's cow and said it was bewitched

third_parties.name: George le Havenaire
third_parties.context: killed by accused in confession for asking for payment for a pot he had sold her

third_parties.name: Jean Jaley
third_parties.context: son-in-law of Jean Lassenatte le vieux; master of the poor previous year; had not given accused bread of poor she wished for 12 weeks earlier

third_parties.name: Dieudonnée Chappouxatte (accused's mother)
third_parties.context: suspected witch; had no fixed residence but 'couroit ca et la par le pays'; chased out of town; died begging; accused of killing daughter of Sebille veuve Claudon Blaise; took accused to sabbat when she was 9 or 10; cooked toads with powder to kill cattle

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial w239 concerns Claudette femme Bastien Delat, executed in 1608. Extensive witness testimony (22 witnesses) detailing disputes over payment, debt, and employment. Pattern of alleged harms following economic disputes. Mother also suspected witch, died as vagrant. Accused confessed under threat of torture to being seduced at age 9-10 by mother, attending sabbat, using magical powders, and killing/harming multiple victims including her own son. Multiple accomplices named. Change de Nancy modified execution to include feeling fire before strangling. Strong economic hardship context throughout.
